item.title: Un hitched articulated trailers being left on a public highway to the point the road at night is over run with trailers and lorrys, 20th November
item.description:
Constant issue L.A seem to avoid the issue and its now getting out of control please see below to be acted on as workers are complaining they cant park safely and the businesses are 24hour Legal and safety considerations Obstruction and safety: Leaving an unhitched trailer can cause an obstruction and be a safety hazard, especially on narrow roads, potentially hindering emergency services. Attachment of brakes: When a trailer is left unhitched, its brake must be set on at least one wheel, or it must be secured by a chain, chock, or other device to prevent it from moving. Parking restrictions: Rules regarding parking on verges, footways, or between carriageways are stricter for heavy goods vehicles, and a trailer parked alone can still be in breach of these rules. Lighting: The trailer must be properly lit if left unattended at night, which can be difficult if it's detached from a vehicle with a power source for lights. Local by-laws: Many local councils have specific by-laws against leaving trailers unattended on public roads, which can lead to fines or removal of the trailer. Vehicle registration: The trailer must be registered and insured, even when unhitched, but this does not give permission to park it in an illegal way. lorry trailers generally cannot be unhitched and left on a public highway because it is often considered an obstruction and a safety hazard, and is illegal for trailers that are not attached to a towing vehicle. While temporary parking might be permissible under specific conditions, leaving a trailer unattended without the towing vehicle is typically against the law or local by-laws
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hailey Road, Lower Belvedere, Erith, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet
